TopicTitle: Part generator Version 2.X release / open beta

Articles.Content: Sorry if it's been mentioned but my thread searching-fu is letting me down. Has the falling through/not colliding with the ground issue been identified? It's one of the very few things that could make this very handy utility closer to perfect

Is this an jpg?

Thats ok, i can convert it,

Thank you, it will be in the next release!

More than welcome, as long as I get the credit!

I love this little application! I put two of the default textures together to make a nice Soyuz-booster-looking fuel tank. Here's the Soyuz showing the extra part (no other parts were added, except for MechJeb modded into the command module):

(Here's the rest of the album http://imgur.com/a/BJB6Z ) Here's the Texture:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/arb7l0qojdrwate/Stock%20Gray%20Orange%20Clean.png

Here's the part. Just put it into the gamedata folder. It has the same fuel as 3/4ths of a double tank, hence the name. It fits pretty well with the theme of the rest of KSP's parts, IMO.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ic8eve1jpqoe7ou/Jimmy.zip

Feel free to use without any restrictions at all, just use at your own risk (of course).

Edited August 5, 2013 by Quantum Jim

Hello thank you for making such an excellent mod. However I have come across a slight problem with using it. The display is cramped making it hard to use and hard to tell what numbers I have entered. Most applications have an option to expand it. However I am unable to do this to this program. I was wondering if anyone had had this problem and if there is an easy way around this problem. Thank you
Nice Korolev Cross.

After a PM from TheCardinal I decided to change the User interface, so it is easier to understand.

Also I decided to change the system for the extra modules, so you can add custom ones (machjeb, ...)

I will try to reproduce and fix the braininator bug.

The Update will be ready next Friday (30. ?)
Like always. Great work and good stuff....

Could you please add "probe control" and decimal numbers? I wanted to create some 67,5cm parts.

Thanks.

Could you please add "probe control" and decimal numbers? I wanted to create some 67,5cm parts.

Thanks.

you're kidding right?

does 0.5 cm make a visible difference in this game?

Can somebody tell me how to end this poll, thanks
Can you link to a version of this that doesn't have a virus in it?

Can you link to a version of this that doesn't have a virus in it?

hmm. what AV do you use?

The link goes to the KSP spaceport.

I personaly uploaded the Program there.

The Program reads and writes files to your Drive (it has to load textures and save the Parts), that could cause alert.

I scanned the files again, nothing detected.

I scanned my PC, incase something atatches it self to the files, nothing.

EDIT: I scanned with multiple AVs and AVAST is giving a Positive result.

I don't know why, I hope Its a false Positive, since I uploaded this file a while ago and this is the first time something like this happens.

I will take it down until I know whats wrong, but AVAST gives a lot of false positives!

EDIT2: LOL using Virustotal.com Avast and 44 other AVs say its clean:

https://www.virustotal.com/de/file/0d6867ac4cc137bf64fbd66dec940f8b3385c03a98de7e908aaf0f3febba9025/analysis/1377443594/

I will upload a new version on friday, so the download will be up again then.

Edited August 25, 2013 by Lando

texture spec is how shiny the light reflection of the texture is.

rim falloff is how strong the light level decreases
